intro: Acisanthera alsinefolia var. glabriuscula, commonly known as the smoothleaf acisanthera, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, and it has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is adapted to survive in harsh environments, with mechanisms to conserve water and withstand high temperatures. This variant is distinguished by its reduced hair coverage compared to the typical form, giving it a smoother appearance.
